<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/27/tim-cook-changed-apple-10-years-hes-ceo?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Tim's Apple, 10 Years On
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/27/tim-cook-changed-apple-10-years-hes-ceo?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Tim Cook sayin hi" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=376 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/TLm3ig25UPL7roCPLC/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Tim Cook sayin hi" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/TLm3ig25UPL7roCPLC/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What did your partner get you for your 10th anniversary? Chances are, it’s a <em>little </em>less generous than the <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-26/apple-ceo-poised-to-get-750-million-final-payout-from-big-award?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$750 million</a> Tim Cook is receiving from Apple as the final tranche of a pay package he secured when he was promoted in 2011.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s right, Cook has been the CEO of Apple for exactly 10 years this week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Morning Brew didn’t exist when he took over the top job but if we did, we would have written about how Cook, who ran Apple’s operations, was handed the daunting task of replacing cofounder and longtime CEO Steve Jobs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Turns out, Apple did a much better job finding its next leader than <em>Jeopardy! </em>did<em> </em>(admittedly a low bar).</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Under Cook, Apple’s market capitalization has grown around 600% to $2.5 trillion, making it the most valuable public company in the world. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Apple’s annual revenue in 2011, when Cook took over, was </span><span><a href="https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/AAPL/apple/revenue?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$108.2 billion</a></span><span>; in 2020 it made $274.5 billion. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Sorry, one more thing—Apple was also the most </span><span><a href="https://www.foxbusiness.com/markets/apple-most-profitable-company-world?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>profitable</em></a></span><span><em> </em></span><span>company in the world in fiscal 2020.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How did that happen?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While the iPhone still reigns supreme, Apple has <a href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/tim-cook-was-named-apples-ceo-10-years-ago-here-are-three-things-he-changed/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expanded</a> its hardware lineup in the last decade and scored hits with the Apple Watch and AirPods. It also made a big move into services (Apple Pay, Apple Music, etc.), a unit that brought in a <a href="https://www.theverge.com/22639629/tim-cook-apple-ten-years-decade-steve-jobs-legacy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">record $17.5 billion</a> in revenue last quarter—nearly half of iPhone sales.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While leading these initiatives, Cook has been a part of a growing number of CEOs who are speaking out on social and political issues. For instance, he criticized former President Trump’s hardline stance on immigration and forcefully defended LGBTQ rights (Cook was the first openly gay CEO of a Fortune 500 company).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Cook still has plenty of problems to deal with, from <a href="https://www.protocol.com/apple-epic-trial/epic-apple-closing-arguments?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">high-stakes legal challenges</a> against Apple’s App Store policies to a more <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/5/25/22453302/apple-culture-secrecy-leak-antonio-garcia-martinez-letter?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">vocal workforce</a> to thorny privacy questions. Will he stay on for another 10 years to solve them? “<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/05/opinion/apples-ceo-is-making-very-different-choices-from-mark-zuckerberg.html?showTranscript=1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Probably not</a>,” Cook told NYT journalist Kara Swisher. — <em>NF</em></p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/27/powell-signals-fed-will-wind-stimulus-measures-coming-months?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Powell on the Economy: “Clear Progress”
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/27/powell-signals-fed-will-wind-stimulus-measures-coming-months?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Jerome Powell sitting at a desk looking concerned " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjMwL2plcm9tZV9wb3dlbGwuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Alex Wong/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Jerome Powell is ready to take the US economy off the injured reserve list. In a highly anticipated speech yesterday, the Fed Chair said that the economy has <a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-health-coronavirus-pandemic-economy-5540a3115d041e10327bfcad2be043e8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recovered enough</a> that “it could be appropriate” to start slowing down some of the Fed’s pandemic-era stimulus measures.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Since July 2020, the Fed has been buying $120 billion worth of bonds and mortgage-backed securities each month to keep markets working like Adam Smith drew them up.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fast forward more than a year, and every investor is desperate to hear when the Fed will begin scaling back those asset purchases—a process known as “tapering.” Without a sufficient heads up, winding down stimulus programs could potentially spark a “<a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/t/taper-tantrum.asp?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">taper tantrum</a>” in financial markets.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">So when will that be? </strong></span><span>After Powell’s speech, Goldman Sachs </span><span><a href="https://www.nxtmine.com/news/articles/economics/wall-street-reacts-to-powells-dovish-nothingburger-speech/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">predicted</a></span><span> that the Fed would give advance notice next month and then formally announce tapering in November. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As for the Fed’s other tool to juice the economy, low interest rates, Powell indicated that hiking interest rates were not on his immediate to-do list. — <em>NF</em></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STOCKS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/27/supportcom-becomes-latest-meme-stock?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Yep, That's a Meme Stock Chart
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Support.com stock price chart starting at 2016 and surging recently to nearly $30" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82NDM3L3N1cHBvcnRfY29tX3N0b2NrX3ByaWNlX2NoYXJ0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Support.com is a relatively unknown software company, considering how high it must rank in Google search results. But it’s under-the-radar no more: Amateur traders are <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/support-com-surges-300-meme-143103542.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gassing it up</a> like friends at a bridal fitting.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Shares of Support.com skyrocketed as much as 203% on Friday, before closing the day up 34%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why Support.com?</strong> For the same reasons that traders doubled down on AMC and GameStop this winter: to profit off of professional investors’ short bets.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last month, Wall Street shorted Support.com’s stock, betting on the company’s stock to go down. Amateur investors bet against their bets, attempting a “short squeeze” that can accelerate a stock’s surge like throwing Mentos into Diet Coke.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But someone must have told the SEC about dramatic irony</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because yesterday it <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/27/sec-steps-up-research-into-gamification-of-trading-with-online-brokers-gary-gensler-says.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched a probe</a> into social media-fueled trading. SEC Chair Gary Gensler said his regulatory agency is looking into how apps like Robinhood gamify trading with features that encourage the kind of frenzied investing activity we’ve seen around meme stocks like Support.com.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the SEC’s investigation could portend a crackdown that might tone down meme stock rallies—with the ultimate goal of protecting amateur traders from catastrophic financial losses.<em> — JW</em></p>

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We all deserve more praise in the workplace—be it for the big things (like kicking butt on a preso), or the little wins (like managing to keep an orchid alive on your desk for more than two months).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.workhuman.com/company/?utm_source=trdparty&utm_medium=prmorningbrew&utm_campaign=2021Q3_PR_WorldGratitudeDay&utm_content=postcalltoaction" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Workhuman</a> is designed to help you and your company <strong style="color:#000">build a more socially connected workforce, grounded in a positive culture of trust, goodwill, and humanity. </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Through <a href="https://www.workhuman.com/resources/globoforce-blog/14-ways-to-celebrate-world-gratitude-day-and-rejuvenate-employee-engagement?utm_source=trdparty&utm_medium=prmorningbrew&utm_campaign=2021Q3_PR_WorldGratitudeDay&utm_content=postcalltoaction" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">workplace recognition and expressing gratitude</a>, teams experience a boost in positivity and well-being, which translates to <strong style="color:#000">better performance and employee retention.</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even gratitude in its simplest form works wonders. When somebody receives more than five formal 'thank you’ moments in a year, <strong style="color:#000">their propensity to leave their organization is cut in half—from about 15% to 7%</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You know what? Thank YOU, Workhuman, for pioneering a more human workplace. It’s true: Without humans, it’s just work.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/27/key-performance-indicators-august-28?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/27/key-performance-indicators-august-28?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">

<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Cristiano Ronaldo scores a goal " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Lqsij1GjWKHLy/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e47gvqdociihiyavfaq38a1ipz9woonjqkjgenr6e07&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Soccer star Cristiano Ronaldo is <a href="https://www.espn.com/soccer/soccer-transfers/story/4462369/cristiano-ronaldo-agrees-stunning-man-united-return?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">returning</a> to his former team Manchester United, and whenever he switches clubs it’s a major business event. When he moved to Italy’s Juventus in 2018, the club <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/juventus-sold-60-million-in-cristiano-ronaldo-jerseys-in-24-hours-2018-7?utm_content=buffer51ea4&utm_medium=social&utm_source=facebook.com&utm_campaign=buffer-bi" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sold 520,000 Ronaldo jerseys</a> (equivalent to $62.4 million in revenue) in the 24 hours after he joined. Plus, Manchester United stock—yes, it’s a publicly traded company—jumped about 6% on the day.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“I don’t know a single person who regularly watches TV financial news. They’re going to these specialized YouTube channels and social media. Giving their money to some guy in a suit on Wall Street, I just don’t think that’s something that would ever even occur to them.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Social media consultant Sarah Petite spoke to the WSJ about the new generation of <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-social-media-stars-who-move-markets-11630056601?mod=hp_lead_pos5" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stock-picking influencers</a> who’ve taken over YouTube. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Inside the daring mission by US special operations vets to rescue Afghan allies. (<a href="https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/us-special-operations-vets-carry-daring-mission-save/story?id=79670236" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ABC News</a>)</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/27/qa-paralympic-gold-medalist-mike-schultz?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Q&A With Paralympic Gold Medalist Mike Schultz
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/27/qa-paralympic-gold-medalist-mike-schultz?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Mike Schultz after winning gold at the 2018 Paralympics" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82NDMzL21pa2Vfc2NodWx0ei5qcGVnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Courtesy of Mike Schultz</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Tokyo 2020 Paralympic Games kicked off Tuesday, featuring high-stakes competition from 4,403 athletes with a range of physical and intellectual disabilities, as well as the first-ever Refugee Paralympic Team.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">USA is currently ranked fifth in medal count, but chill, it’s only Day 5. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To learn about what it takes to be a Paralympic champion, we asked gold medal-winning snowboarder Mike Schultz what was harder: winning the gold or starting his company, <a href="https://www.biodaptinc.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">BioDapt</a>, which provides lower-limb prosthetics for action sports. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Here’s a snippet:</strong></span><span> “Winning the gold is extremely tough, and in the short-term sense, it takes a lot of commitment to be 100% all the way through the competition. But starting a business is an ongoing set of challenges. So, I'd have to say the business is definitely more challenging for me,” he said. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You can read the full interview with Mike Schultz <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/27/monster-mike-schultz-talks-paralympic-games-winning-gold-2018-disney-channel-original-movies?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">More Paralympics content:</strong> You can catch some of the events on *sigh* Peacock; follow some of our fave athletes like long jumper <a href="https://twitter.com/LexGillette?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Lex Gillette</a> and swimmers <a href="https://twitter.com/JessicaLong?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Jessica Long</a> and <a href="https://twitter.com/malloryweggeman?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mallory Weggemann</a> on social media; or dive deep into the competition referred to as “<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AmvXbrrOAkU" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">murderball</a>.”<em> — MM</em></p>

width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat did your partner get you for your 10th anniversary? Chances are, it’s a \u003cem\u003elittle \u003c/em\u003eless generous than the \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-26/apple-ceo-poised-to-get-750-million-final-payout-from-big-award?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$750 million\u003c/a\u003e Tim Cook is receiving from Apple as the final tranche of a pay package he secured when he was promoted in 2011.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat’s right, Cook has been the CEO of Apple for exactly 10 years this week.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMorning Brew didn’t exist when he took over the top job but if we did, we would have written about how Cook, who ran Apple’s operations, was handed the daunting task of replacing cofounder and longtime CEO Steve Jobs.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTurns out, Apple did a much better job finding its next leader than \u003cem\u003eJeopardy! \u003c/em\u003edid\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003e(admittedly a low bar).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUnder Cook, Apple’s market capitalization has grown around 600% to $2.5 trillion, making it the most valuable public company in the world. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eApple’s annual revenue in 2011, when Cook took over, was \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/AAPL/apple/revenue?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$108.2 billion\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e; in 2020 it made $274.5 billion. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSorry, one more thing—Apple was also the most \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.foxbusiness.com/markets/apple-most-profitable-company-world?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eprofitable\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ecompany in the world in fiscal 2020.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow did that happen?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile the iPhone still reigns supreme, Apple has \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/tim-cook-was-named-apples-ceo-10-years-ago-here-are-three-things-he-changed/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpanded\u003c/a\u003e its hardware lineup in the last decade and scored hits with the Apple Watch and AirPods. It also made a big move into services (Apple Pay, Apple Music, etc.), a unit that brought in a \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/22639629/tim-cook-apple-ten-years-decade-steve-jobs-legacy?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecord $17.5 billion\u003c/a\u003e in revenue last quarter—nearly half of iPhone sales.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile leading these initiatives, Cook has been a part of a growing number of CEOs who are speaking out on social and political issues. For instance, he criticized former President Trump’s hardline stance on immigration and forcefully defended LGBTQ rights (Cook was the first openly gay CEO of a Fortune 500 company).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eCook still has plenty of problems to deal with, from \u003ca href=\"https://www.protocol.com/apple-epic-trial/epic-apple-closing-arguments?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehigh-stakes legal challenges\u003c/a\u003e against Apple’s App Store policies to a more \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/5/25/22453302/apple-culture-secrecy-leak-antonio-garcia-martinez-letter?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evocal workforce\u003c/a\u003e to thorny privacy questions. Will he stay on for another 10 years to solve them? “\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/05/opinion/apples-ceo-is-making-very-different-choices-from-mark-zuckerberg.html?showTranscript=1\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eProbably not\u003c/a\u003e,” Cook told NYT journalist Kara Swisher. — collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJerome Powell is ready to take the US economy off the injured reserve list. In a highly anticipated speech yesterday, the Fed Chair said that the economy has \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/business-health-coronavirus-pandemic-economy-5540a3115d041e10327bfcad2be043e8?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecovered enough\u003c/a\u003e that “it could be appropriate” to start slowing down some of the Fed’s pandemic-era stimulus measures.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eSince July 2020, the Fed has been buying $120 billion worth of bonds and mortgage-backed securities each month to keep markets working like Adam Smith drew them up.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFast forward more than a year, and every investor is desperate to hear when the Fed will begin scaling back those asset purchases—a process known as “tapering.” Without a sufficient heads up, winding down stimulus programs could potentially spark a “\u003ca href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/terms/t/taper-tantrum.asp?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etaper tantrum\u003c/a\u003e” in financial markets.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo when will that be? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAfter Powell’s speech, Goldman Sachs \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nxtmine.com/news/articles/economics/wall-street-reacts-to-powells-dovish-nothingburger-speech/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epredicted\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that the Fed would give advance notice next month and then formally announce tapering in November. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs for the Fed’s other tool to juice the economy, low interest rates, Powell indicated that hiking interest rates were not on his immediate to-do list. — \u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSupport.com is a relatively unknown software company, considering how high it must rank in Google search results. But it’s under-the-radar no more: Amateur traders are \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/support-com-surges-300-meme-143103542.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egassing it up\u003c/a\u003e like friends at a bridal fitting.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eShares of Support.com skyrocketed as much as 203% on Friday, before closing the day up 34%.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy Support.com?\u003c/strong\u003e For the same reasons that traders doubled down on AMC and GameStop this winter: to profit off of professional investors’ short bets.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast month, Wall Street shorted Support.com’s stock, betting on the company’s stock to go down. Amateur investors bet against their bets, attempting a “short squeeze” that can accelerate a stock’s surge like throwing Mentos into Diet Coke.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut someone must have told the SEC about dramatic irony\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBecause yesterday it \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/27/sec-steps-up-research-into-gamification-of-trading-with-online-brokers-gary-gensler-says.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunched a probe\u003c/a\u003e into social media-fueled trading. SEC Chair Gary Gensler said his regulatory agency is looking into how apps like Robinhood gamify trading with features that encourage the kind of frenzied investing activity we’ve seen around meme stocks like Support.com.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe SEC’s investigation could portend a crackdown that might tone down meme stock rallies—with the ultimate goal of protecting amateur traders from catastrophic financial losses.\u003cem\u003e —
